page.title: 10CHURCH
page.content: The church was built by Sir John Trveleyan of Wallington in 1842, and stands on the top of the little hill on which the village is built.Many members of the Trevelyan family are buried in the churchyard,which is now full,so that the community also has a cementary just outside the village. Until 1978 a vicar lived in the village,since then the vicar has been shared with two neighbouring parishes.There is normally one service in the church every Sunday not always at athe same time.There are 20-30 names on the electoral roll ot the church,average attendance at each service is about 10.Thee is a parochial church council responsible for the running of the church,care of the building and grounds raising funds for the church's share of the vicar's stipend and expenses.
